page.title: 08MR THURSTON - FUNFAIR OWNER
page.content: ON MONDAY 17TH JUNE, DEAN ALLGOOD AND CRAIG CLOSE, TWO PUPILS FROM ARBURY PRIMARY SCHOOL, VISITED MR THURSTON ON MIDSUMMER COMMON. "IT TOOK ABOUT 5 MINUTES TO FIND MR THURSTON. HE TOLD US HE HAD BEEN TRAVELLING WITH THE FAIR ALL OF HIS LIFE. HE IS THE FOURTH GENERATION OF HIS FAMILY TO OWN THE FAIR. HIS GREAT GRANDFATHER STARTED WORKING WITH THE FAIR. THERE ARE ABOUT 40 RIDES IN THE FAIR, AND IT TAKES ABOUT 3 DAYS TO SET THESE UP WHEN THEY ARRIVE AT A NEW SITE. MR THURSTON SAID HIS FAVOURITE RIDE WAS THE DODGEMS. THE FAIR TRAVELS MOSTLY AROUND EAST ANGLIA AND THEY ARE REGULAR VISITORS TO CAMBRIDGE FOR THE MIDSUMMER FAIR."
